alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Hamilton, western Fulton, southeastern Herkimer and western Montgomery Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ohio to near Little Falls to Morris. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Little Falls, Ohio and Middleville around 500 PM EDT. Dolgeville around 510 PM EDT. Stratford around 525 PM EDT. Caroga Lake and Caroga Lake Public Campground around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ingham Mills, Spinnerville, Whitehouse, Mindenville, Kelhi Corners, Shedd Corners, Ripple Corners, Powley Place, West Saint Johnsville and Bleecker Center. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 29 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Montgomery; Northern Fulton; Southern Fulton; Southern Herkimer
